heading: passage: deforest kelley, 79
subheading: the actor who made the words, "dammit, jim," a quotable for thousands of star trek viewers passed away friday. born 20 january 1920, deforest kelley had childhood aspirations of becoming a doctor, but began an acting career when his family couldn't afford medical school. later he landed the role of dr. mccoy on the original trek series and also appeared in several movies, including gunfight at the o.k. corral, and in tv westerns. co-star leonard nimoy reflects, "he represented humanity and it fitted him well. he was a decent, loving, caring partner and will be deeply missed."
author: wired staff
text: the actor who made the words, "dammit, jim," a quotable for thousands of  star trek viewers passed away friday. born 20 january 1920, deforest kelley had childhood aspirations of becoming a doctor, but began an acting career when his family couldn't afford medical school. later he landed the role of dr. mccoy on the original trek series and also appeared in several movies, including gunfight at the o.k. corral, and in tv westerns. co-star leonard nimoy reflects, "he represented humanity and it fitted him well. he was a decent, loving, caring partner and will be deeply missed."
